Upright Meaning: Good luck, karma, and the cycle of life.
Reversed Meaning: Bad luck, resistance to change, and upheaval.
Affirmation: "I embrace the cycles of change and growth."
Traditional Interpretation: Representing the ebb and flow of life and fate.
Modern Interpretation: Emphasizing change and the acceptance of life's fluctuations.
Mythological Connection: Associated with the Greek Moirai, or Fates.
Numerology: The number 10 signifies completion, wholeness, and the beginning of a new cycle.
Rider-Waite Description: Depicts a large wheel with various mystical symbols, representing the cycles of fate.
Alternative Deck Descriptions: Some decks show the Wheel of Fortune with zodiac signs and mystical symbols.
Card Image Description: A large wheel adorned with symbols and mystical creatures, representing the cycles of fate.

Reversed Meaning: Injustice, unfairness, and lack of accountability.
Affirmation: "I seek balance and justice in all aspects of my life."
Traditional Interpretation: Symbolizing fairness, law, and ethical decisions.
Modern Interpretation: Emphasizing the importance of truth and balanced judgment.
Mythological Connection: Linked to Themis, the Greek goddess of justice.
Numerology: The number 11 signifies intuition, justice, and spiritual insight.
Rider-Waite Description: Depicts a figure holding a sword and scales, seated between two pillars.
Alternative Deck Descriptions: In some decks, Justice is shown with symbols of law and balance.
Card Image Description: A figure seated between two pillars, holding a sword and scales, symbolizing fairness and balance.

Upright Meaning: Surrender, contemplation, and gaining new insights.
Affirmation: "I embrace new perspectives and let go of the old."
Traditional Interpretation: Representing self-sacrifice and the wisdom gained through surrender.
Modern Interpretation: Emphasizing the value of viewing situations from different angles.
Mythological Connection: Associated with Odin, who hung from Yggdrasil for wisdom.
Numerology: The number 12 signifies completion, cycles, and the blending of opposites.
Rider-Waite Description: Depicts a man hanging upside down from a tree, with a serene expression and a glowing halo.
Alternative Deck Descriptions: Some decks show the Hanged Man as a figure in contemplation, often inverted.
Card Image Description: A man hanging upside down from a tree, with a glowing halo around his head.

Upright Meaning: Major change, transformation, and the end of a cycle.
Reversed Meaning: Resistance to change, stagnation, and fear of new beginnings.
Affirmation: "I embrace transformation and the new beginnings it brings."
Traditional Interpretation: Representing the end of a phase and the start of a new one.
Modern Interpretation: Emphasizing transformation and the need to let go of the past.
Mythological Connection: Linked to Hades, the god of the underworld.
Numerology: The number 13 signifies transformation, renewal, and change.
Rider-Waite Description: Depicts a skeletal figure in black armor riding a white horse, carrying a banner.
Alternative Deck Descriptions: In some decks, Death is shown as a transformative force rather than a figure.
Card Image Description: A skeletal figure in black armor riding a white horse, carrying a banner with a white rose.

Affirmation: "I seek balance and harmony in all aspects of my life."
Traditional Interpretation: Representing the blending of opposites and finding equilibrium.
Modern Interpretation: Emphasizing the need for balance and moderation in life.
Mythological Connection: Associated with Iris, the goddess of the rainbow and balance.
Numerology: The number 14 signifies temperance, balance, and synthesis.
Rider-Waite Description: Depicts an angelic figure pouring water between two cups, with one foot on land and one in water.
Alternative Deck Descriptions: Some decks show Temperance as a figure blending elements or energies.
Card Image Description: An angelic figure with one foot on land and one in water, pouring water between two cups.
